location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. Circled serial numbers written in crayon (red for incoming, blue for outgoing correspondence) refer to entries in the notes at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at 1 on the front cover and terminates at 21 on the back cover. The numbers are written in pencil and appear in the top right hand corner of the recto page of each folio. Foliation anomaly: 3, 3A.

mods.abstract: The file relates to the disappearance and issue of a warrant for the arrest of Christopher Alberts, a cashier with Petroleum Development (Qatar) Limited, following the misappropriation of a sum of 65,000 rupees belonging to the Company. The papers include correspondence from Petroleum Development (Qatar) Limited; Petroleum Concessions Limited; the Political Agent, Bahrain (Cornelius James Pelly); the office of the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and the Government of India. The papers also include discussion of the question of whether the Fugitive Offenders Act 1881 could be applied if, as seemed likely, Alberts had fled to Goa, March 1948; and a copy of the warrant for Alberts's arrest, signed by Pelly, 6 April 1948.Note that the 'D' in Alberts's name in the file title appears to be an error.
